intro: Eriogonum bakeri, commonly known as Baker's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and meadows. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eriogonum bakeri is an important component of local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various wildlife species.
